author: raybucks
content: hello,Many websites posts analysis from any trader and other shit , is there any crypto news sites which keep us up to date , site maybe small or big Cointelegraph is good and provide all news first then other site copy them no? but i don't like interfaceI think bitcoin.com is best

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: raybucks on January 08, 2023, 02:11:13 PMI think bitcoin.com is best That website is owned by bcashers, who, last time I've checked, were still trying to convince the world that their altcoin is the true bitcoin.This being said, simply I don't trust their news are always correct/good.So I'd recommend looking for other news sources too.I will add some possible entries to "the list":https://defidive.com/news?filter=bitcoinhttps://bitcoinmagazine.com/And for the actual info (not news) on bitcoin:https://bitcoin.org/https://learnmeabitcoin.com/https://en.bitcoin.it/

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: The reputable ones are CoinDesk, Cointelegraph, and The Block. I wouldn't really use these sites for trading-related stuff though; as you're pretty much reacting really slow if you're just going to base your information off news sites. I'd personally rather follow people directly on Twitter, but you do you.

comments.body: I'd also take note of these op,Â  Nasdaq, CoinMarketCap, CoinDesk. It would help to have a varied number of sites to choose from. But the sites recommended by @NeuroticFish give better insights if you want more knowledge about Bitcoin and crypto.

comments.author: franky1
comments.created_time: January 08, 2023, 03:05:28 PMLast edit: January 08, 2023, 03:16:19 PM by franky1
comments.body: best advice..read multiple "news" sites and then check their sourceswhen a site mentions something its quoting. find the source quote and check the context. verify its validity or atleast learn the full content/context of a 'snipped'/'sniped' quotesome sites lean towards certain biases and make "opinion" pieces that lean the quotes towards a certain sentiment.. i see many sites quote something but then highlight a source as another puffpiece made by same site or another media site. rather than the original sourcecoindesk does this alot. quotes other media sites and itself. rather than for instance linking in a link to an actual court filing or regulator announcement

comments.author: bitzizzix
comments.body: It is difficult to say which cryptocurrency news site is the best because there are many factors that must be considered when saying the best, because those who judge the best site are ourselves, which is not necessarily the best for others, and vice versa.CoinDesk, BitcoinTalk, Twitter, and Reddit are the best sources for news and cryptocurrency related.and i also use CoinMarketCap if i want to track cryptocurrency exchange rate, actually there are many best source sites or anything related to cryptocurrency. But it all depends on what you need, and I use it a lot with what I listed above which I find great.

comments.author: buwaytress
comments.body: mk4's suggestion are probably what I'd say are the most reputable too -- The Block, anyway, the one I'd rank the highest there. Just ignore all sponsored posts (they're usually clearly marked and are just a minor step up from pure Press Release type or advertisement posts) as those have the lowest quality and most dubious sources (they're paid for, so can't really blame them for using a common media business model).Crypto Town Crier is my occasional "how to read between the lines of the real news" site but they seem to have taken a break in the last month. I was formerly affiliated with Bitcoin News also, and while their content is a bit iffy, it does strive to be more of a commentary site than breaking news (and their Telegram is... at times interesting).

Try using social networks like Twitter and Reddit, where you will see the most important news discussed instead of trying to follow the whole news every day.

comments.author: albon
comments.body: Quote from: crunck on January 08, 2023, 03:23:29 PMThere are countless crypto news websites and it is impossible to say which is the best to follow. Cryptocurrency news is endless and I don't think you can follow all of them. Try using social networks like Twitter and Reddit, where you will see the most important news discussed instead of trying to follow the whole news every day.Blogs and websites are good and reliable sources for receiving news better than social media sites, as anyone on Twitter or Reddit and others can publish any false news, There are many good websites that the OP can check out for the latest cryptocurrency and bitcoin news daily. For me, I prefer the following websites which have exclusive news and simple and easy interface for readers :1- https://cryptonews.com/2- https://www.coindesk.com/3- https://www.cnbc.com/cryptoworld/4- https://www.investing.com/news/cryptocurrency-news@OP After looking at these sites that I mentioned to you, you can put them in the Bookmarks of your browser so that it is easier for you to open them from time to time.

In addition, I think this forum is also a place for you to update market news from everyone's posts, and more specifically, we can exchange and discuss related issues. comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: These are my list of trusted news source for bitcoin news, some of them are mentioned already since these are the popular ones- CoinDesk- CoinTelegraph- Bitcoin Magazine- Forbes- FortuneDon't just focus on one or two of them, when there's a trending news/headline, always use google and on different sources. Don't be fooled a press release on a news because most PR are clickbait.

comments.author: uneng
comments.body: Better to search for bitcoin on google, then click on "news" filter and you will see most recent results for your research. Theoretically most important and impacting news will appear on top, so you don't miss anything relevant. Moreover, by doing this, local news portals from your country will also be displayed as relevant news, then you have access to real time updates of bitcoin news in your country which are usually not covered by big portals.
